author: gstonehouse
title: Arsenal and Tottenham send scouts to watch highly-rated Toulouse defender Issa Diop star against PSG
text:
Arsenal and Tottenham send scouts to watch highly-rated Toulouse defender Issa Diop star against PSG 
North London rivals set to slog it out to bring French defender to Premier League BY GARY STONEHOUSE Comments ARSENAL and Tottenham are reportedly preparing to battle it out to sign Toulouse defender Issa Diop. 
Scouts from the north London giants were in attendance at Parc des Princes on Sunday night as the French Under-21 star helped his side hold PSG to a goalless draw. Getty Images 4 Arsenal and Tottenham scouts were in attendance to watch Issa Diop at the Parc des Princes on Sunday 
That was Diop’s 20th appearance of the season and his impressive performances are now starting to attract attention from Premier League clubs. 
Keep up to date with ALL the Arsenal and Tottenham news, gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
Both the Gunners and Spurs have already been alerted to him, and the rivals are expected to continue monitoring his progress for the rest of the Ligue 1 season. 
It was France Football that reported on the talent spotters for Arsene Wenger and Mauricio Pochettino being in the French capital. related articles Blaise Matuidi reveals sensational reply from Andres Iniesta to his Marco Verratti comment Footballer death shock Paul McCarthy dead aged 45 as ex-Brighton man suffers a suspected heart attack GAME ON Atletico Madrid open to offers for France striker Kevin Gameiro this summer putting Tottenham on alert 'Smile at life' Alexis Sanchez insists he is dedicated to Arsenal after rumours of dressing room rift in touching message IAN WRIGHT Arsenal have no excuses... Sutton's plastic pitch should suit Arsene Wenger's side down to the ground 
But hopes of a summer move for the ace could be complicated, and expensive. 
The 20-year-old only penned a new contract with Toulouse last summer, which runs until 2020. 
And that means that the his current side will be able to command a hefty fee for the promising youngster. Getty Images Diop starred as he helped Toulouse grab a 0-0 draw against big guns PSG Getty Images Issa Diop pictured in action against Lorient’s former Arsenal striker Jeremie Aliadiere Getty Images 4 Diop has scored two goals in 20 appearances from centre-half for Toulouse this season 
Diop has been capped at U16, U17, U18 and U19 level for France before breaking into the U21 set-up this season, appearing four times. 
His grandfather, Ladbysse Diop, was the first Senegalese footballer to ever play in the French top-flight. Goals of the 5th Round - Watch the best strikes from the weekend FA Cup action
